alert.note: Alert for Decatur (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 1:27PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT JACKSON...NORTHWESTERN CALHOUN... CENTRAL WALTON...HOLMES...WASHINGTON COUNTIES IN THE PANHANDLE OF FLORIDA AND SOUTHWESTERN DECATUR COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN GEORGIA THROUGH 200 PM EDT/100 PM CDT/... At 127 PM EDT/1227 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Chattahoochee to near Marianna to 12 miles southeast of De Funiak Springs to 12 miles northeast of Santa Rosa Beach. Movement was northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Vernon, De Funiak Springs, Bonifay, Marianna, Chipley, Graceville, Eglin Air Force Base, Chattahoochee, Bradford, Union, Live Oak, Malone, Sneads, Freeport, Cottondale, Grand Ridge, Greenwood, Ponce De Leon, Altha, and Alford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
